presidents.description: Was a widely known hermit in the High Peaks of the Adirondack Mountains of New York State. He kept extensive journals over a period of several decades, many of which were written in letter-substitution ciphers of his own invention.
A wilderness guide, pilot, and conservationist. One of his enduring legacies is the classification of land in the Park as either forest or wilderness.
The  first person to summit the 46 high peaks?
